questions.title: Question 1: What is the primary function of a robot's chassis?
options: a. Provide structure and support for the robot
d. Supply power to the robot
questions.explanation: The chassis provides structure and support for all the components of the robot.

questions.title: Question 2: Which component acts as the brain of the robot?
questions.explanation: The microcontroller processes sensor data and controls the robot's movements.

questions.title: Question 3: What is the primary role of sensors in a robot?
options: a. Provide power to the robot
c. Detect and measure environmental conditions
questions.explanation: Sensors detect and measure various environmental conditions, providing essential data for the robot's operation.

questions.title: Question 4: What is inverse kinematics used for in robotics?
options: a. Calculating the position of the end effector
b. Determining the joint angles needed to place the end effector at a specific position
c. Measuring the force applied by the robot
d. Controlling the speed of the robot
questions.explanation: Inverse kinematics is used to determine the joint angles required to move the end effector to a specified position.

questions.title: Question 5: What is the purpose of a gripper on a robotic arm?
options: b. To provide power to the robot
c. To grasp and manipulate objects
questions.explanation: A gripper is an end effector used by a robotic arm to grasp and manipulate objects.

questions.title: Question 6: Which type of motor is commonly used for precise control of robotic joints?
questions.explanation: Servo motors are commonly used for precise control of robotic joints.

questions.title: Question 7: What is the purpose of a robot's control system?
options: a. To process sensor data and control the robot's movements
c. To generate power for the robot
questions.explanation: The control system processes sensor data and controls the robot's movements.

questions.title: Question 8: How do robots perceive their environment?
questions.explanation: Robots use sensors to perceive their environment and gather data for decision-making.

questions.title: Question 9: What is the significance of feedback in robotic control systems?
options: b. To measure and adjust the robot's actions based on sensor data
c. To control the robot's speed
questions.explanation: Feedback in control systems allows the robot to measure and adjust its actions based on sensor data, ensuring accurate and adaptive behavior.

questions.title: Question 10: Which component of a robotic arm determines the degrees of freedom?
questions.explanation: The joints of a robotic arm determine its degrees of freedom.

questions.title: Question 11: What is the primary function of actuators in a robotic arm?
questions.explanation: Actuators drive the joints of a robotic arm, enabling its movement.

questions.title: Question 12: What is a common use of sensors in robotic arms?
options: c. To provide feedback on position and force
questions.explanation: Sensors in robotic arms provide feedback on position and force, which is essential for precise control.

questions.title: Question 13: What is the purpose of a vision system in a robot?
options: b. To enable the robot to perceive and interpret its environment
c. To control the robot's movements
questions.explanation: A vision system enables a robot to perceive and interpret its environment through visual data.

questions.title: Question 14: Which technology is commonly used in robotic vision systems for image processing?
questions.explanation: Neural networks are commonly used in robotic vision systems for image processing.

questions.title: Question 15: What is a typical application of a vision system in industrial robots?
questions.explanation: Vision systems in industrial robots are typically used for quality control and inspection.
